alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:10PM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen and southeast New York, including the following county, Rockland. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding continues from earlier rainfall. Many small rivers and streams are beginning to crest, but it will take several hours for water levels to recede. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1207 PM EST, The stage at the Hackensack River at New Milford was 8.40 ft, which is moderate flood stage. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Losen Slofe, Sparta Brook, Tenakill Brook, Cresskill Brook, Cherry Brook, Bear Brook, Passaic River, Sprout Brook, Hudson River, Mill Creek, Berrys Creek, Sparkill Creek, Overpeck Creek, Hirshfeld Brook, Herring Brook, Hackensack River and Pocantico River. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hackensack, Bergenfield, Rutherford, Nanuet, Ridgefield, Nyack, Tappan, Fort Lee, Englewood, Pearl River, Oradell, Norwood, Orangeburg, Teterboro, Teaneck, Lodi, Cliffside Park, Palisades Park, Dumont and New Milford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
